item.description:
Hi All,
Last Tuesday, we had a meeting with Armand Dufresne from Gale Assoc. Seems there have been more questions arising out of that meeting.

I am suggesting we have an additional meeting on Wednesday night, September 29th at 6:00 at Bullock Hangar. I will ask Armand to attend again. Chaiman Kit Walker said he'd be there also.

This is open to anyone on KFIT, not just the FPA.

Some of the questions/answers/concerns are:

What kind of approaches would be available after the new runway goes in? Gale didn't know if we'd get anything.
Why not do some soil testing to see if the soil is useable for a runway before spending monies on photographs and plans?
Will the new runway be an improvement or just a change?
We all thought it was a fact that it had to be done, Gale said otherwise.
If the 5000 ft is displaced, will jets be able to use it still?
If we just re did the current 32/14, wouldn't that be less disruptive and keep the same non precision approaches?
Can FIT maintain 2/20 if 32/14 stays?
What about the taxiways and run up areas for the new runway?

Skyhaven had input from their users. Here's their efforts. Click the link top see their Airport Planning Survey Results.

http://www.skyhavennh...

See you all then,
Charley

group.name: Fitchburg Pilots Association/EAA Chapter 1454 Meetup Site

item.name: Runway Improvement Updates
